Posts.Content: Jillt wrote: I got the results of my scans today. My cancer has not spread and a couple of the lung tumors are shrinking.  My lung mets were originally found in jan 2007 on a routine scan.  They had continued to grow with chemo (cmf and carbo). At the end of August I had more chemo and a stem cell transpant (clinical trial) and now they are shrinking!   They can't be sure if this is a result of the chemo, transplant or both.  I don't care.  I fnally got a good scan! Jill Jill Dx 2/16/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jillt wrote: A few minutes after we got home from my CT scan my oncologist called. I knew there was trouble if he was calling himself.  He told me that they found a blood clot in my lung. Geez what the heck...what's the next problem going be? I have been having pain behind my left knee, so they think the original clot is there. Yesterday I noticed that my left foot was swollen.I'm thinking I am geting lymphedema and cursing that.  I am having an ultrasound on Wed so they can confirm where the original clot is located.  The treatment is to put me on blood thinners.  I will be giving myself injections twice a day until the pills they put me on kick in.  I guess it's a good thing that I had a CT scan scheduled before I had a pulmonary embolism. Jill Dx 2/16/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I have a blood clot in my lung Jillt Watson

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 09:26PM Jillt wrote: There are two types of stem cell transplants.  An autologous transplant uses your own stem cells and is really just a way of getting a very high dose chemo treatment.   A allogenic transplant uses a donor with the goal that there will be a safe level of rejection going on between you and your donor that will actually fight the cancer.   With breast cancer it has not been proven to extend life.  I did have a allogenic transplant through a trial at NIH.  I did this because my tumors continued to grow through all the chemos that I tried.  My tumors have done some shrinking since by transplant  on8/28 and I hae not had any progression elsewhere.  I don't think I will end up NED as a result of the transplant alone.  It is likely that I will need more chemo and hopefully my new immune system (from my brother) will respond to the chemo.

Posts.Content: Jillt wrote: I have emailed with some people from this board about the trial I hoping to get into. I just want to post the info in case anyone else out there has mets that are not responding to standard treatments. I am currently in Maryland being tested and evaluted for a Stem Cell transplant (my brother will be my donor - there is a 25% chance that a full sibling will be a 6/6 match). I will find out on Tuesday if we everything checks out. Here is the info on the trial: http://clinicalstudies.info.nih.gov/cgi/wais/bold032001.pl?A_04-C-0131.html@04-C-0131 I have a web site that I am tracking my progess on. If you are interested I can PM you the link. Jill Jill Dx 2/16/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
